perturbation.changed_text:
6.
TERM: November 01, 2014 to October 31, 2017, unless terminated earlier as per section 16.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction because while the term is defined as ending on October 31, 2017, the added clause suggests it can be terminated earlier. Section 16 does not exist, which creates uncertainty about the conditions for earlier termination and conflicts with the defined term.

perturbation.original_text:
14.
OTHER PROVISIONS:
It is agreed that no personal liability whatsoever shall attach to, be imposed on or otherwise be incurred by any Partner, agent,
management official or employee of the Transporter or any director, officer or employee of any of the foregoing, for any obligation
of the Transporter arising under this Agreement or for any claim based on such obligation and that the sole recourse of Shipper
under this Agreement is limited to assets of the Transporter.
perturbation.changed_text:
14.
OTHER PROVISIONS:
It is agreed that no personal liability whatsoever shall attach to, be imposed on or otherwise be incurred by any Partner, agent,
management official or employee of the Transporter or any director, officer or employee of any of the foregoing, for any obligation
of the Transporter arising under this Agreement or for any claim based on such obligation and that the sole recourse of Shipper
under this Agreement is limited to assets of the Transporter. However, in cases of gross negligence or willful misconduct, the Shipper may pursue claims against the Transporter's management officials and employees.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating that while generally there is no personal liability, an exception exists for gross negligence or willful misconduct. This contradicts the initial statement of no personal liability and creates ambiguity about when the limitation of liability applies, and under what circumstances Shipper can pursue claims against management.

perturbation.original_text:
12.
INCORPORATION OF TARIFF INTO AGREEMENT:

to time. Transporter may file and seek Commission approval under Section 4 of the Natural Gas Act (NGA) at any time and from
time to time to change any rates, charges or provisions set forth in the applicable Rate Schedule (as stated above) and the
"General Terms and Conditions" in Transporter's FERC Gas Tariff, Third Revised Volume No. 1, and Transporter shall have the
right to place such changes in effect in accordance with the NGA, and this Agreement shall be deemed to include such changes
and any such changes
perturbation.changed_text:
12.
INCORPORATION OF TARIFF INTO AGREEMENT:
This Agreement shall incorporate and in all respects be subject to the "General Terms and Conditions" and the applicable Rate
Schedule (as stated above) set forth in Transporter's FERC Gas Tariff, Third Revised Volume No. 1, as may be revised from time
to time. Transporter may file and seek Commission approval under Section 4 of the Natural Gas Act (NGA) at any time and from
time to time to change any rates, charges or provisions set forth in the applicable Rate Schedule (as stated above) and the
"General Terms and Conditions" in Transporter's FERC Gas Tariff, Third Revised Volume No. 1, and Transporter shall have the
right to place such changes in effect in accordance with the NGA, and this Agreement shall be deemed to include such changes
and any such changes. However, any changes to the Rate Schedule that increase rates by more than 10% within a 12-month period shall require Shipper's written consent.
perturbation.explanation: This change adds a condition requiring the Shipper's written consent for rate increases exceeding 10% within a year. This directly contradicts the previous statement that the agreement is subject to changes filed under the Natural Gas Act, which would typically not require individual shipper consent. This creates an inconsistency regarding how rate changes are implemented and whether the Shipper has veto power over certain increases.
